thread.title: My GF's fucking cat will not stop fucking pissing
thread.title_full: /an/ - My GF's fucking cat will not stop fucking pissing - Animals & Nature - 4chan

posts.author: Anonymous
posts.text:
It started pissing on the couch because You went too long cleanign the litterbox and it because to dirty for it to want to use. Now it's has come accustomed to the couch as another place it can piss. You may not be able to smell the piss but your can't clean deep enough with the enzyme cleaner to get it all all. You just need to break the habit. Keep the litter box clean and cover the couch in plastic for a while until the cat forgets that it's an available piss spot.
That's assuming there are no other animals in the house that could make this a territorial problem in which case it's totally different.

thread.title: Nasa plans new rover for Mars 2020 mission - Livemint
thread.title_full: Nasa plans new rover for Mars 2020 mission - Livemint

posts.title: Nasa plans new rover for Mars 2020 mission - Livemint
posts.text:
Last Published: Wed, Nov 29 2017. 06 57 PM IST Nasa plans new rover for Mars 2020 mission The Nasa’s next mission to Mars in 2020 will feature a souped-up unmanned rover vehicle to search for signs of ancient microbial life in areas of the uninhabitable red planet Reuters Nasa’s new rover will study the Mars terrain, above and below the surface, and collect soil and rock samples. Photo: Bloomberg 
The National Aeronautics and Space Administration’s (Nasa) next mission to Mars in 2020 will feature a souped-up unmanned rover vehicle to search for signs of ancient microbial life in areas of the uninhabitable red planet. 
The successor to the 2012 Curiosity rover, which could launch in July or August 2020, will be equipped with seven new instruments and re-designed wheels, Nasa’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) said. 
The new vehicle will study the Mars terrain, above and below the surface, and collect soil and rock samples. 
“What we learn from the samples collected during this mission has the potential to address whether we’re alone in the universe,” said Ken Farley, a JPL scientist with the Mars 2020 project. 
JPL is also developing a new landing technology that will allow the rover to visit sites deemed too risky for Curiosity and shave miles off its journey. 
Nasa has successfully landed spacecraft on Mars seven times and is using the International Space Station to prepare for human missions to the moon and Mars. First Published: Wed, Nov 29 2017. 06 55 PM IST

organizations.name: bloomberg  the national aeronautics and space administration

thread.title: Macron In Qatar To Discuss Terror Financing
thread.title_full: Macron In Qatar To Discuss Terror Financing

posts.author: FOW 24 News (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Macron In Qatar To Discuss Terror Financing
posts.text:
French President Emmanuel Macron arrived, in Qatar, on Thursday, for an hours-long trip to the country amid a boycott of Doha by four Arab nations.... 
Immediately after landing, Macron traveled to the vast al-Udeid Air Base, home to some 10,000 American troops and the forward headquarters of the US military’s Central Command.

France also has a contingent of soldiers at the base, which is crucial to the ongoing fight against the ISIS group in Iraq and Syria and to the war in Afghanistan.

Macron smiled and shook hands with the French and American soldiers who greeted him at the base before walking into a meeting with the base’s top commanders, according to AP.

The French president later will hold talks with Qatar’s ruling emir, Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, according to local media outlets.
The two heads of state will also chair a “meeting for bilateral cooperation in the fight against terrorism, the financing of terrorism and radicalization”, which they will commit both to renew regularly.

Macron’s visit comes just after a planned two-day Gulf Cooperation Council meeting collapsed in just a few hours over the ongoing Qatar diplomatic crisis, as Qatar is still refusing to change its policies towards terrorism and its financing activities.

“It will also be an opportunity to prepare the international conference organized on the subject in Paris in January,” said the entourage of the French president. Pierre Bousquet of Florian, national coordinator of intelligence and the fight against terrorism, is said to be accompanying Macron, according to Le Monde.

There are also reports in the French media that Macron wants to use Qatar as a gateway to calm the atmosphere with Iran, which has become the guardian of Doha.

persons.name: sheikh tamim bin hamad al thani

thread.title: Brexit jargon explained: What's the difference between regulatory alignment and regulatory divergence?
thread.title_full: Brexit jargon explained: What's the difference between regulatory alignment and regulatory divergence?

posts.title: Brexit jargon explained: What's the difference between regulatory alignment and regulatory divergence?
posts.text:
1 comment 
As Brexit talks get ever more detailed and intense, Shaun Connolly, Press Association political correspondent explains the jargon and looks at the next steps 
PRIME Minister Theresa May is battling to break the deadlock over the Irish border after a proposed deal collapsed on Monday, with the clock ticking ahead of a crunch summit on December 14. 
The EU insists that trade talks can begin only after “sufficient progress” has been made on the three key divorce issues of citizens’ rights, the Irish border and the UK’s financial settlement. 
Loading article content 
And Dublin has warned that unless the UK provides cast-iron guarantees that the border will remain open, it will not allow Brexit negotiations moving on to the second phase – including trade talks – before the end of the year. 
Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionists – who prop up the Government in Parliament – have insisted they will not sign up to a proposal for Northern Ireland to remain in “regulatory alignment” with the Republic once Britain has left the EU. 
Meanwhile Dublin has demanded assurances from the UK that there would not be any “regulatory divergence” between Northern Ireland and the Republic after Brexit. 
What’s the difference between “continued regulatory alignment” and “regulatory divergence”? 
THE word “alignment” offers a more flexible ambiguity to the sticky issue of the Irish border, which would have given London and Dublin more wriggle room to sell the idea of “frictionless” trade to their respective audiences. 
It adds a looser, more EU-style fluidity to the concept of avoiding a hard border after withdrawal as “regulatory convergence” implies a stricter regime when it comes to standards and practices on both sides of the dividing line. And “regulatory divergence” suggests a clear break in some areas. 
But even the “alignment” level of ambiguity was considered too strong by the DUP for them to accept, so it’s back to the dictionary to find a fresh form of words as the Irish Government says it will give Downing Street some space to deal with “presentational” problems. 
How does phase two of talks differ from phase one? 
FOR Remainers hoping that Brexit was just a phase, the bad news is that it is in fact two phases – and the first one was meant to be the relatively easy part. 
Phase one concentrates on legacy “divorce” issues, such as the exit bill, the rights of British citizens living in the EU and those of EU nationals living here, as well as the Irish border. Phase two is intended to hammer out a post-Brexit trade agreement between the UK and the EU27, but bloc leaders will only sign off on opening the second section of talks if they deem “sufficient progress” has been made on legacy negotiations at a summit in Brussels next week. 
What is sufficient progress? 
WHATEVER the EU insists upon, it would appear, given the sudden eagerness of London to finally wrap up phase one as exemplified by the apparent acceptance that the Brexit bill will be up to £50bn, rather than the £18bn initially indicated by Downing Street. 
Some sort of role for the European Court of Justice on citizens’ rights has also been talked of, along with the wordplay surrounding the Irish border issue. 
So what are the key dates coming up? 
DECEMBER 14 and 15. A scheduled two-day European Council summit offers a new opportunity for the EU27 leaders to decide whether talks can move on to trade. Failure to do so at this stage would mean crisis for Theresa May, with escalating calls for her to prepare to quit the EU without a deal. Figures in the City have warned that firms will start moving staff and functions out of the UK if it is not clear by Christmas what transitional arrangements will be in place to avoid a cliff-edge Brexit. 
What is the schedule for early next year? 
IF talks are proceeding to plan, negotiators can be expected to be getting into the nitty-gritty on how future trade relations will work while ironing out final details of the divorce deal during the winter and spring. 
On March 22 and 23 there is a European Council summit in Brussels. If talks have not moved on to the second phase by then, the process will be in serious crisis, with time running out for any discussion of trade and companies across the UK forced to plan for the possibility that there will be no deal. Mrs May will come under pressure to pull out of talks. In May, English local government elections will provide the Prime Minister with her first widespread electoral test since the disastrous snap election of June 8, 2017. 
Michel Barnier hopes to be able to conclude withdrawal negotiations around this point in order to allow time for them to be ratified before the end of the two-year Article 50 deadline on March 29, 2019. On this date, the UK ceases to be a member of the EU and is no longer subject to its treaties, whether or not a withdrawal agreement has been reached. Because the exact moment of exit is midnight Brussels time, the UK is due to leave at 11pm on March 29.

thread.title: Cuba Tour Meeting Requirements
thread.title_full: Cuba Tour Meeting Requirements - Cruise Critic Message Board Forums

posts.author: SuzCruise
posts.text:
For the car tour, I'd recommend Tours by Blexie. We had a fabulous experience with George, who works with Tours by Blexie. Blexie had given us a suggested itinerary which we customized and George did a great job making sure we saw it all. He was a real pleasure to spend the day with. He speaks fabulous English, is well versed in history and all of the sites in Havana and made us feel totally at ease asking questions about life in Cuba. And these are Cuban citizens, not affiliated with the government, perfectly in line with Supporting the Cuban People. I can't recommend them highly enough!

thread.title: The 6th
thread.title_full: The 6th

posts.author: Fi (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: The 6th
posts.text:
When I stop at the cross 
I can see the love of God. 
But I can’t see competition. 
I can’t see hierarchy. 
I can’t see pride or prejudice 
or the abuse of authority. 
I can’t see lust for power. 
I can’t see manipulation. 
I can’t see rage or anger 
or selfish ambition. 
I can’t see unforgiveness. 
I can’t see hate or envy. 
I can’t see stupid fighting 
or bitterness, or jealousy. 
I can’t see empire building. 
I can’t see self-importance. 
I can’t see back-stabbing 
or vanity or arrogance. 
I see surrender, sacrifice, salvation, 
humility, righteousness, faithfulness, grace, forgiveness, love! 
Godfrey Birtill

I love today's meditation; it reminds me of all the things I should reject and by those things I reject shows what and who I am striving to be. If we strive to embody love, to reflect it in all we do, these are the things we must actively turn from.

Scripture 
Strengthen the weary hands, and make firm the feeble knees. Say to the anxious, ‘Be strong, fear not. 
Isaiah 35:3-4a

posts.author: Richard F
posts.text: Thanks @myrm @schonefeld and @minxbaby I was planning to take the unlimited pass twice for $22 which will last me for 6days which means i spend only $44 for all 5days for unlimited travel on public transport. I wanna spend more time trying different cuisines, seeing the country, meeting new ppl, trying new bars.I always chck a place and then get my whole family. So i will do the park hopping next time with my family .Also looking at the amount of time for the 4 parks it will be better when i have company. Please suggest any authentic places for non vegetarian food for budget tourists. i love pork and sea food and love the flavors. I definitely am gonna try the Roti Prata, Chilli Crab at Jumbo and Pork dishes at Haw Par

thread.section_title: Singapore Forum, Travel Discussion for Singapore - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Singapore for 5 Days
thread.title_full: Singapore for 5 Days - Singapore Forum - TripAdvisor

posts.author: teebs2593
posts.text: Your budget of $400 is for everything you want to do in the 5 days you are in Singapore? In that case, if you have chilli crab at Jumbo, that is going to set you back at least $70. And you mentioned Pork dishes at Haw Par? If you mean Haw Par Villa, there aren't any restaurants there. Basically speaking if you want to keep food costs low, you should be looking at food courts or hawker centres. Seafood dishes are never cheap even at hawker centres. I'm not sure what you mean by pork dishes or which type of pork dishes you are referring to. basically if you want to try new dishes, then you should be going for things like Chinese, Indian, Malay, Korean, Japanese food etc. As for travelling by public transport in Singapore, the ezlink card might be a better option compared to the unlimited pass at $22.

thread.section_title: Portrait and People Photography Forum: Digital Photography Review
thread.title: Question About Reflectors:
thread.title_full: Question About Reflectors: Portrait and People Photography Forum: Digital Photography Review

posts.author: Krav Maga
posts.text:
Quote: :
Krav Quote: :
I've never used a reflector. I usually use OCF. In fact, even if I don't particularly need to use flash, I'll almost always use it if I can because it usually improves the shot; filling in shadows, etc.
However, using a flash can be cumbersome. Even a simple single speed light/modifier set up.
I do some photographing of people on the street; going up to them, asking them if I can take their pic. I'd like to be able to use a reflector if possible and have thought about getting a small--20"--silver/gold reflector that I could either hold or give to the subject for them to hold.
Does anyone here have any experience with using a small reflector by themselves, without an assistant?
Yes.
Reflectors come in handy even for natural light photography. A reflector can be almost anything. A book or a newspaper held below the chest can make a big difference. Standing the subject next to a wall or seated at a white table can make a difference.
One time I used a white plastic cutting board held by the subject just below the frame.
Is it even a realistic approach?
See above.
Any thoughts or input would be appreciated.
-- hide signature -- I feel more like I do now than I did before ...
https://www.flickr.com/photos/144454453@N02/
Tedolph
Thanks for the response.
Yes, almost anything can be used. I once positioned someone in the shade facing the hood of a white car reflecting light. That worked well.
What I'm after is to both provide fill, and catch lights in the eyes if possible.
-- hide signature -- I feel more like I do now than I did before ...
https://www.flickr.com/photos/144454453@N02/

thread.section_title: Portrait and People Photography Forum: Digital Photography Review
thread.title: Question About Reflectors:
thread.title_full: Question About Reflectors: Portrait and People Photography Forum: Digital Photography Review

posts.author: KE_DP
posts.text:
Especially with a smaller reflector the aim is going to be more important... holding it at just the right angle and proximity. Short of having an assistant....
If you are holding it you would have to be pretty close to the person - and be able to shoot steady one handed.
If the person holds it they are going to need to be posed/aimed in the proper holding position/angle. And then try to get them to also pose for the photo on top.
The better option is a stand and reflector arm to hold it for you - if it's not windy. - By that time you may as well have a light on a stand.
You might also find a hot shoe flash either on camera, or on a camera bracket might be used judiciously to gain extra light. As long as it's just a bit of fill only you won't get that deer in the headlights look.
-- hide signature -- - Karen
http://www.karenengelphotography.com
Follow us on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/karenengelphotography/

TEdolph
I've seen images with catch lights provided by a small reflector. Maybe not technically catch lights, but the reflector is visible in the eyes. Perhaps better wording would be catch light like.
I haven't, it must look odd.
Remember what catch lights are supposed to look like a window.
Preferably with mullions in the upper light and plane in the lower light, as if you were in Rembrandt's studio sitting next to a window. The further away from that you get, the stranger it looks.

I've never used a reflector. I usually use OCF. In fact, even if I don't particularly need to use flash, I'll almost always use it if I can because it usually improves the shot; filling in shadows, etc.
However, using a flash can be cumbersome. Even a simple single speed light/modifier set up.
I do some photographing of people on the street; going up to them, asking them if I can take their pic. I'd like to be able to use a reflector if possible and have thought about getting a small--20"--silver/gold reflector that I could either hold or give to the subject for them to hold.
Does anyone here have any experience with using a small reflector by themselves, without an assistant?
Yes.
Reflectors come in handy even for natural light photography. A reflector can be almost anything. A book or a newspaper held below the chest can make a big difference. Standing the subject next to a wall or seated at a white table can make a difference.
One time I used a white plastic cutting board held by the subject just below the frame.
Is it even a realistic approach?
See above.
Any thoughts or input would be appreciated.
-- hide signature -- I feel more like I do now than I did before ...
https://www.flickr.com/photos/144454453@N02/
Tedolph
Thanks for the response.
Yes, almost anything can be used. I once positioned someone in the shade facing the hood of a white car reflecting light. That worked well.
What I'm after is to both provide fill, and catch lights in the eyes if possible.
A reflector will not provide catch lights.
You are going to have to use flash, or a window for that.
-- hide signature -- I feel more like I do now than I did before ...
https://www.flickr.com/photos/144454453@N02/
TEdolph
I've seen images with catch lights provided by a small reflector. Maybe not technically catch lights, but the reflector is visible in the eyes. Perhaps better wording would be catch light like.
-- hide signature -- I feel more like I do now than I did before ...
https://www.flickr.com/photos/144454453@N02/

ul { margin: 0; }
And it should work.

Krav Quote: :
I've never used a reflector. I usually use OCF. In fact, even if I don't particularly need to use flash, I'll almost always use it if I can because it usually improves the shot; filling in shadows, etc.
However, using a flash can be cumbersome. Even a simple single speed light/modifier set up.
I do some photographing of people on the street; going up to them, asking them if I can take their pic. I'd like to be able to use a reflector if possible and have thought about getting a small--20"--silver/gold reflector that I could either hold or give to the subject for them to hold.

If you think using a flash is cumbersome, I don't see how you can even consider using a reflector by yourself. Trying to hold a camera steady with one hand while trying to properly aim a reflector, even a small one is no fun. No fun X 10 if there's any bit of a breeze.

thread.section_title: Portrait and People Photography Forum: Digital Photography Review
thread.title: Question About Reflectors:
thread.title_full: Question About Reflectors: Portrait and People Photography Forum: Digital Photography Review

posts.author: Suntan
posts.text:
In the situation you are talking about, reflectors can be a PITA for you or the subject to hold. When you are trying to hold them, you can't really do anything with the camera except push the shutter. When the subject is holding them, you tend to get a picture that looks like someone is smiling while holding something.
It is much better to have a third person, that you can give direction to, hold the reflector. That doesn't mean you need an assistant, any friend of the subject is smart enough to hold a reflector per your instructions. Something to think about.
You can get some of those pop-up reflectors pretty cheap from B&H or Amazon, your best bet is to buy a cheap one and see how you get on with it.
